Entities.csv

Based on Entities.csv and Relationships.csv - Proceed and Create 3 individual CSV code-blocks (alternative: files) in chat named: Goals.csv + Conditions.csv + DecisionVariables.csv
Goals.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
Conditions.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,IsSum,GoalType,EntityName,EntityAttribute,CriteriaType,Weight"
DecisionVariables.csv must have the following header: "ID,Name,Description,DataType,Domain,MinValue,MaxValue"

The following conventions must be applied:
ID starts with a letter G(oals), C(onditions), D(ecision)V(ariables) and a number follows, starting at 0, 1, 2, ....
Name is written snake_case
Names for Goals must begin with "maximize_" or "minimize_"
IsSum is a boolean { True, False }
GoalType is one of { "min", "max" }
EntityName is always only 1 entry from the "Name" of Entities.csv
EntityAttribute is one of the values in the "Attribute0" to "Attribute8" of the targeted Entity in Entities.csv
CriteriaType is a number { 2 = Must-Match, 1 = May-Match, 0 = Cannot-Match }
Domain can represent set of values like "{0,1}"
MinValue is the smallest value that can be set
MaxValue is the highest value that can be set
Weight is a mulptlier
Created 10 to 15 entries in each of these files.

9c4d2cad-dda3-4483-9a2e-eba91c8d6585.content:
Use ALL of the previously provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Relations, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) and formulate the optimization model mathematically and logically. 
Write it into a code-block for a LaTeX (.tex) file and provide the generated Latex code in chat.
The file consists of a introduction page with Title, Author, Date and Table of Contents.
The actual file contest consists of 5 different \sections labeled "1. Sets (Entities)", "2. Indices", "3. Goals", "4. Conditions", "5. DecisionVariables"
The items of each category are itemized between \begin and \end.
Goals and Conditions show both their IDs, Names and the logical and mathematical representation

content_list.content:
Here is a complete `.tex` LaTeX file that formulates the optimization model based on your domain model (Entities, Relationships, Goals, Conditions, and Decision Variables). The document includes:

- Title page with **Title**, **Author**, **Date**
- Table of Contents
- Five sections:
  1. Sets (Entities)
  2. Indices
  3. Goals (with IDs, Names, logical & mathematical expressions)
  4. Conditions (with IDs, Names, logical & mathematical expressions)
  5. Decision Variables

All content is typeset using `itemize`, and mathematical expressions are properly formatted.

---

```latex
\documentclass[12pt]{article}
\usepackage{amsmath, amssymb, graphicx, hyperref, enumitem}
\usepackage[a4paper, margin=2.5cm]{geometry}
\usepackage{titlesec}

\title{Optimization Model for SCRUM-Based Software Development}
\author{Domain Modeling & Optimization Team}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle

\tableofcontents
\newpage

\section{1. Sets (Entities)}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \mathcal{P} $: Set of Projects $ = \{ p \mid p \in \text{Project} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{T} $: Set of Teams $ = \{ t \mid t \in \text{Team} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{W} $: Set of Workers $ = \{ w \mid w \in \text{Worker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{F} $: Set of Features $ = \{ f \mid f \in \text{Feature} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{S} $: Set of Skills $ = \{ s \mid s \in \text{Skill} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{R} $: Set of Roles $ = \{ r \mid r \in \text{Role} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PO} $: Set of Product Owners $ = \{ po \mid po \in \text{ProductOwner} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SM} $: Set of Scrum Masters $ = \{ sm \mid sm \in \text{ScrumMaster} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PB} $: Set of Product Backlogs $ = \{ pb \mid pb \in \text{ProductBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SP} $: Set of Sprints $ = \{ sp \mid sp \in \text{Sprint} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{US} $: Set of User Stories $ = \{ us \mid us \in \text{UserStory} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{TSK} $: Set of Tasks $ = \{ tsk \mid tsk \in \text{Task} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{BL} $: Set of Blockers $ = \{ bl \mid bl \in \text{Blocker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SH} $: Set of Stakeholders $ = \{ sh \mid sh \in \text{Stakeholder} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{VEL} $: Set of Velocity Records $ = \{ vel \mid vel \in \text{Velocity} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{REP} $: Set of Release Plans $ = \{ rep \mid rep \in \text{ReleasePlan} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{RM} $: Set of Roadmaps $ = \{ rm \mid rm \in \text{Roadmap} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{DEV} $: Set of Development Snapshots $ = \{ dev \mid dev \in \text{DevelopmentSnapshot} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{FED} $: Set of Feature Documentations $ = \{ fed \mid fed \in \text{FeatureDocumentation} \} $
\end{itemize}

\section{2. Indices}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ p \in \mathcal{P} $: Index for Projects
    \item $ t \in \mathcal{T} $: Index for Teams
    \item $ w \in \mathcal{W} $: Index for Workers
    \item $ f \in \mathcal{F} $: Index for Features
    \item $ s \in \mathcal{S} $: Index for Skills
    \item $ r \in \mathcal{R} $: Index for Roles
    \item $ po \in \mathcal{PO} $: Index for Product Owners
    \item $ sm \in \mathcal{SM} $: Index for Scrum Masters
    \item $ pb \in \mathcal{PB} $: Index for Product Backlogs
    \item $ sp \in \mathcal{SP} $: Index for Sprints
    \item $ us \in \mathcal{US} $: Index for User Stories
    \item $ tsk \in \mathcal{TSK} $: Index for Tasks
    \item $ bl \in \mathcal{BL} $: Index for Blockers
    \item $ sh \in \mathcal{SH} $: Index for Stakeholders
    \item $ vel \in \mathcal{VEL} $: Index for Velocity records
    \item $ rep \in \mathcal{REP} $: Index for Release Plans
    \item $ rm \in \mathcal{RM} $: Index for Roadmaps
    \item $ dev \in \mathcal{DEV} $: Index for Development Snapshots
    \item $ fed \in \mathcal{FED} $: Index for Feature Documentations
\end{itemize}

\section{3. Goals}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{G0: maximize\_team\_productivity} \\
    Maximize average story points completed per sprint. \\
    $ \max \sum_{vel \in \mathcal{VEL}} \omega_{G0} \cdot \text{avg\_story\_points}(vel) $

    \item \textbf{G1: minimize\_sprint\_blockers} \\
    Minimize number of unresolved blockers during a sprint. \\
    $ \min \sum_{bl \in \mathcal{BL}} \omega_{G1} \cdot \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(bl) \neq \text{``resolved''}] $

    \item \textbf{G2: maximize\_feature\_delivery} \\
    Maximize number of completed features per release. \\
    $ \max \sum_{f \in \mathcal{F}} \omega_{G2} \cdot \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(f) = \text{``completed''}] $

    \item \textbf{G3: minimize\_task\_effort\_deviation} \\
    Minimize difference between estimated and actual effort. \\
    $ \min \omega_{G3} \cdot \left| \text{effort}(tsk) - \text{actual\_effort}(tsk) \right| $ for each $ tsk \in \mathcal{TSK} $

    \item \textbf{G4: maximize\_stakeholder\_satisfaction} \\
    Maximize stakeholder influence-weighted feedback. \\
    $ \max \sum_{sh \in \mathcal{SH}} \omega_{G4} \cdot \text{influence\_level}(sh) $

    \item \textbf{G5: minimize\_sprint\_goal\_failure} \\
    Minimize number of sprints where goal was not achieved. \\
    $ \min \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} \omega_{G5} \cdot \mathbb{I}[\text{achievement\_of\_goal}(sp) = \text{``failed''}] $

    \item \textbf{G6: maximize\_worker\_utilization} \\
    Maximize total assigned availability of workers. \\
    $ \max \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} \omega_{G6} \cdot \text{availability}(w) $

    \item \textbf{G7: minimize\_epic\_cycle\_time} \\
    Minimize time from epic creation to completion. \\
    $ \min \omega_{G7} \cdot \text{estimated\_effort}(e) $ for each $ e \in \mathcal{E} $

    \item \textbf{G8: maximize\_documentation\_coverage} \\
    Maximize ratio of documented features to total features. \\
    $ \max \sum_{fed \in \mathcal{FED}} \omega_{G8} \cdot \frac{|\text{linked\_requirements}(fed)|}{|\mathcal{F}|} $

    \item \textbf{G9: minimize\_sprint\_planning\_duration} \\
    Minimize total time spent in sprint planning meetings. \\
    $ \min \sum_{spp \in \mathcal{SPP}} \omega_{G9} \cdot \text{duration\_(min)}(spp) $

    \item \textbf{G10: maximize\_release\_plan\_adherence} \\
    Maximize number of planned features actually released. \\
    $ \max \sum_{rep \in \mathcal{REP}} \omega_{G10} \cdot |\text{included\_features}(rep)| $

    \item \textbf{G11: minimize\_daily\_scrum\_overrun} \\
    Minimize average daily scrum duration beyond 15 minutes. \\
    $ \min \omega_{G11} \cdot \max(0, \text{duration}(ds) - 15) $ for each $ ds \in \mathcal{DS} $

    \item \textbf{G12: maximize\_team\_stability} \\
    Maximize number of team members with status 'active'. \\
    $ \max \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} \omega_{G12} \cdot \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(w) = \text{``active''}] $

    \item \textbf{G13: minimize\_development\_snapshot\_defects} \\
    Minimize test failures in development snapshots. \\
    $ \min \sum_{dev \in \mathcal{DEV}} \omega_{G13} \cdot \mathbb{I}[\text{test\_status}(dev) = \text{``failed''}] $

    \item \textbf{G14: maximize\_skill\_coverage} \\
    Maximize number of required skills present in the team. \\
    $ \max \sum_{s \in \mathcal{S}} \omega_{G14} \cdot \text{level}(s) $
\end{itemize}

\section{4. Conditions}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{C0: require\_worker\_email\_validity} \\
    All workers must have valid email addresses. \\
    $ \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{email}(w) \neq \emptyset \land \text{valid\_email}(\text{email}(w)) $

    \item \textbf{C1: enforce\_sprint\_duration\_limit} \\
    All sprints must not exceed 30 days. \\
    $ \forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: (\text{end\_date}(sp) - \text{start\_date}(sp)) \leq 30 $

    \item \textbf{C2: ensure\_unique\_project\_names} \\
    Project names must be unique. \\
    $ \forall p_1, p_2 \in \mathcal{P}, p_1 \neq p_2 \Rightarrow \text{name}(p_1) \neq \text{name}(p_2) $

    \item \textbf{C3: require\_product\_owner\_presence} \\
    Each Product Backlog must have an assigned Product Owner. \\
    $ \forall pb \in \mathcal{PB}: \exists po \in \mathcal{PO} \text{ such that } \text{manages\_backlog}(po, pb) $

    \item \textbf{C4: enforce\_task\_status\_validity} \\
    Tasks must have a valid status. \\
    $ \forall tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}: \text{status}(tsk) \in \{\text{todo}, \text{in progress}, \text{done}\} $

    \item \textbf{C5: require\_sprint\_goal\_defined} \\
    Sprint must have a defined goal before starting. \\
    $ \forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: \text{status}(sp) = \text{active} \Rightarrow \exists sg \in \mathcal{SG} \text{ s.t. } \text{pursues\_goal}(sp, sg) \land \text{objective\_description}(sg) \neq \emptyset $

    \item \textbf{C6: limit\_team\_size} \\
    Team size must not exceed 12 members. \\
    $ \forall t \in \mathcal{T}: \text{team\_size}(t) \leq 12 $

    \item \textbf{C7: enforce\_backlog\_ordered} \\
    Product Backlog must maintain prioritized order. \\
    $ \forall f_1, f_2 \in \mathcal{F} \cap \mathcal{PB}: \text{priority}(f_1) < \text{priority}(f_2) \Rightarrow f_1 \text{ precedes } f_2 $

    \item \textbf{C8: require\_blocker\_resolution\_time} \\
    High-severity blockers must be resolved within 48 hours. \\
    $ \forall bl \in \mathcal{BL}: \text{severity}(bl) = \text{high} \Rightarrow (\text{resolved\_on}(bl) - \text{detected\_on}(bl)) \leq 2 $

    \item \textbf{C9: ensure\_worker\_role\_assignment} \\
    Each worker must have at least one role. \\
    $ \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \exists r \in \mathcal{R} \text{ s.t. } \text{takes\_on\_role}(w, r) $

    \item \textbf{C10: require\_feature\_priority} \\
    All features must have a defined priority level. \\
    $ \forall f \in \mathcal{F}: \text{priority}(f) \in \{1,2,3\} $

    \item \textbf{C11: enforce\_sprint\_review\_participation} \\
    At least 3 stakeholders must attend each Sprint Review. \\
    $ \forall sr \in \mathcal{SR}: \text{attendees\_count}(sr) \geq 3 $

    \item \textbf{C12: require\_velocity\_calculation} \\
    Velocity must be calculated using at least 3 past sprints. \\
    $ \forall vel \in \mathcal{VEL}: \text{number\_of\_sprints\_used}(vel) \geq 3 $

    \item \textbf{C13: ensure\_documentation\_author\_tracked} \\
    All feature documentation must have an author. \\
    $ \forall fed \in \mathcal{FED}: \text{author}(fed) \neq \emptyset $

    \item \textbf{C14: enforce\_release\_status\_tracking} \\
    All release plans must have a current status. \\
    $ \forall rep \in \mathcal{REP}: \text{status}(rep) \in \{\text{planned}, \text{in progress}, \text{completed}\} $
\end{itemize}

\section{5. DecisionVariables}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \mathbf{x}_{tsk,w} \in \{0,1\} $: Task assignment — 1 if task $ tsk $ is assigned to worker $ w $, else 0.
    \item $ a_w \in [0, 160] $: Worker availability in hours per sprint.
    \item $ d_{sp} \in [5, 30] $: Duration of sprint $ sp $ in days.
    \item $ p_{sp} \in [1, 50] $: Planned story points for sprint $ sp $.
    \item $ r_f \in [1, 10] $: Priority rank of feature $ f $.
    \item $ n_t \in [3, 12] $: Number of members in team $ t $.
    \item $ v_{rep} \in [1.0, 10.0] $: Version number of release plan $ rep $.
    \item $ c_{fed} \in [0.0, 1.0] $: Completion fraction of feature documentation $ fed $.
    \item $ s_{bl} \in \{1,2,3,4,5\} $: Severity level of blocker $ bl $.
    \item $ m_{ds} \in [5, 30] $: Duration of daily scrum $ ds $ in minutes.
    \item $ l_{w,s} \in \{1,2,3,4,5\} $: Skill level of worker $ w $ in skill $ s $.
    \item $ g_{sp} \in [0, 100] $: Achievement score (\%) of sprint goal for $ sp $.
    \item $ \delta_{tsk} \in [-20.0, 20.0] $: Deviation between estimated and actual effort for task $ tsk $.
    \item $ \omega_{sh} \in [0.1, 1.0] $: Influence weight of stakeholder $ sh $.
    \item $ \tau_{vel} \in \{-1, 0, 1\} $: Velocity trend (-1: down, 0: stable, 1: up).
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
```

---

### ✅ How to Use This File

1. Save the content as `scrum_optimization.tex`.
2. Compile using `pdflatex` or Overleaf.
3. Output: A professional PDF with structured optimization model.

### 🔍 Notes

- All **Goals** are maximized or minimized as per `GoalType`.
- **Conditions** are hard constraints (must-match, `CriteriaType = 2`) unless otherwise modeled.
- **Weights** $ \omega_{Gx} $ represent the `Weight` column from `Goals.csv`.
- Indicator functions $ \mathbb{I}[\cdot] $ are used for counting logical conditions.
- Sets are derived directly from `Entities.csv` and named using `SetName`.

Let me know if you'd like a version with objective function aggregation, constraint relaxation, or integration with a solver (e.g., Gurobi, CPLEX syntax).

CriteriaType is a number { 2 = Must-Match, 1 = May-Match, 0 = Cannot-Match }
Domain can represent set of values like "{0,1}"
MinValue is the smallest value that can be set
MaxValue is the highest value that can be set
Weight is a mulptlier
Created 10 to 15 entries in each of these files.

Use ALL of the previously provided and generated CSV data (Entities, Relations, Goals, Conditions, DecisionVariables) and formulate the optimization model mathematically and logically. 
Write it into a code-block for a LaTeX (.tex) file and provide the generated Latex code in chat.
The file consists of a introduction page with Title, Author, Date and Table of Contents.
The actual file contest consists of 5 different \sections labeled "1. Sets (Entities)", "2. Indices", "3. Goals", "4. Conditions", "5. DecisionVariables"

content_list.content:
Here is a complete `.tex` LaTeX file that formulates the optimization model based on your domain model (Entities, Relationships, Goals, Conditions, and Decision Variables). The document includes:

- Title page with **Title**, **Author**, **Date**
- Table of Contents
- Five sections:
  1. Sets (Entities)
  2. Indices
  3. Goals (with IDs, Names, logical & mathematical expressions)
  4. Conditions (with IDs, Names, logical & mathematical expressions)
  5. Decision Variables

All content is typeset using `itemize`, and mathematical expressions are properly formatted.

---

```latex
\documentclass[12pt]{article}
\usepackage{amsmath, amssymb, graphicx, hyperref, enumitem}
\usepackage[a4paper, margin=2.5cm]{geometry}
\usepackage{titlesec}

\title{Optimization Model for SCRUM-Based Software Development}
\author{Domain Modeling & Optimization Team}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}

\maketitle

\tableofcontents
\newpage

\section{1. Sets (Entities)}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \mathcal{P} $: Set of Projects $ = \{ p \mid p \in \text{Project} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{T} $: Set of Teams $ = \{ t \mid t \in \text{Team} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{W} $: Set of Workers $ = \{ w \mid w \in \text{Worker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{F} $: Set of Features $ = \{ f \mid f \in \text{Feature} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{S} $: Set of Skills $ = \{ s \mid s \in \text{Skill} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{R} $: Set of Roles $ = \{ r \mid r \in \text{Role} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PO} $: Set of Product Owners $ = \{ po \mid po \in \text{ProductOwner} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SM} $: Set of Scrum Masters $ = \{ sm \mid sm \in \text{ScrumMaster} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{PB} $: Set of Product Backlogs $ = \{ pb \mid pb \in \text{ProductBacklog} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SP} $: Set of Sprints $ = \{ sp \mid sp \in \text{Sprint} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{US} $: Set of User Stories $ = \{ us \mid us \in \text{UserStory} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{TSK} $: Set of Tasks $ = \{ tsk \mid tsk \in \text{Task} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{BL} $: Set of Blockers $ = \{ bl \mid bl \in \text{Blocker} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{SH} $: Set of Stakeholders $ = \{ sh \mid sh \in \text{Stakeholder} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{VEL} $: Set of Velocity Records $ = \{ vel \mid vel \in \text{Velocity} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{REP} $: Set of Release Plans $ = \{ rep \mid rep \in \text{ReleasePlan} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{RM} $: Set of Roadmaps $ = \{ rm \mid rm \in \text{Roadmap} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{DEV} $: Set of Development Snapshots $ = \{ dev \mid dev \in \text{DevelopmentSnapshot} \} $
    \item $ \mathcal{FED} $: Set of Feature Documentations $ = \{ fed \mid fed \in \text{FeatureDocumentation} \} $
\end{itemize}

\section{2. Indices}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ p \in \mathcal{P} $: Index for Projects
    \item $ t \in \mathcal{T} $: Index for Teams
    \item $ w \in \mathcal{W} $: Index for Workers
    \item $ f \in \mathcal{F} $: Index for Features
    \item $ s \in \mathcal{S} $: Index for Skills
    \item $ r \in \mathcal{R} $: Index for Roles
    \item $ po \in \mathcal{PO} $: Index for Product Owners
    \item $ sm \in \mathcal{SM} $: Index for Scrum Masters
    \item $ pb \in \mathcal{PB} $: Index for Product Backlogs
    \item $ sp \in \mathcal{SP} $: Index for Sprints
    \item $ us \in \mathcal{US} $: Index for User Stories
    \item $ tsk \in \mathcal{TSK} $: Index for Tasks
    \item $ bl \in \mathcal{BL} $: Index for Blockers
    \item $ sh \in \mathcal{SH} $: Index for Stakeholders
    \item $ vel \in \mathcal{VEL} $: Index for Velocity records
    \item $ rep \in \mathcal{REP} $: Index for Release Plans
    \item $ rm \in \mathcal{RM} $: Index for Roadmaps
    \item $ dev \in \mathcal{DEV} $: Index for Development Snapshots
    \item $ fed \in \mathcal{FED} $: Index for Feature Documentations
\end{itemize}

\section{3. Goals}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{G0: maximize\_team\_productivity} \\
    Maximize average story points completed per sprint. \\
    $ \max \sum_{vel \in \mathcal{VEL}} \omega_{G0} \cdot \text{avg\_story\_points}(vel) $

    \item \textbf{G1: minimize\_sprint\_blockers} \\
    Minimize number of unresolved blockers during a sprint. \\
    $ \min \sum_{bl \in \mathcal{BL}} \omega_{G1} \cdot \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(bl) \neq \text{``resolved''}] $

    \item \textbf{G2: maximize\_feature\_delivery} \\
    Maximize number of completed features per release. \\
    $ \max \sum_{f \in \mathcal{F}} \omega_{G2} \cdot \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(f) = \text{``completed''}] $

    \item \textbf{G3: minimize\_task\_effort\_deviation} \\
    Minimize difference between estimated and actual effort. \\
    $ \min \omega_{G3} \cdot \left| \text{effort}(tsk) - \text{actual\_effort}(tsk) \right| $ for each $ tsk \in \mathcal{TSK} $

    \item \textbf{G4: maximize\_stakeholder\_satisfaction} \\
    Maximize stakeholder influence-weighted feedback. \\
    $ \max \sum_{sh \in \mathcal{SH}} \omega_{G4} \cdot \text{influence\_level}(sh) $

    \item \textbf{G5: minimize\_sprint\_goal\_failure} \\
    Minimize number of sprints where goal was not achieved. \\
    $ \min \sum_{sp \in \mathcal{SP}} \omega_{G5} \cdot \mathbb{I}[\text{achievement\_of\_goal}(sp) = \text{``failed''}] $

    \item \textbf{G6: maximize\_worker\_utilization} \\
    Maximize total assigned availability of workers. \\
    $ \max \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} \omega_{G6} \cdot \text{availability}(w) $

    \item \textbf{G7: minimize\_epic\_cycle\_time} \\
    Minimize time from epic creation to completion. \\
    $ \min \omega_{G7} \cdot \text{estimated\_effort}(e) $ for each $ e \in \mathcal{E} $

    \item \textbf{G8: maximize\_documentation\_coverage} \\
    Maximize ratio of documented features to total features. \\
    $ \max \sum_{fed \in \mathcal{FED}} \omega_{G8} \cdot \frac{|\text{linked\_requirements}(fed)|}{|\mathcal{F}|} $

    \item \textbf{G9: minimize\_sprint\_planning\_duration} \\
    Minimize total time spent in sprint planning meetings. \\
    $ \min \sum_{spp \in \mathcal{SPP}} \omega_{G9} \cdot \text{duration\_(min)}(spp) $

    \item \textbf{G10: maximize\_release\_plan\_adherence} \\
    Maximize number of planned features actually released. \\
    $ \max \sum_{rep \in \mathcal{REP}} \omega_{G10} \cdot |\text{included\_features}(rep)| $

    \item \textbf{G11: minimize\_daily\_scrum\_overrun} \\
    Minimize average daily scrum duration beyond 15 minutes. \\
    $ \min \omega_{G11} \cdot \max(0, \text{duration}(ds) - 15) $ for each $ ds \in \mathcal{DS} $

    \item \textbf{G12: maximize\_team\_stability} \\
    Maximize number of team members with status 'active'. \\
    $ \max \sum_{w \in \mathcal{W}} \omega_{G12} \cdot \mathbb{I}[\text{status}(w) = \text{``active''}] $

    \item \textbf{G13: minimize\_development\_snapshot\_defects} \\
    Minimize test failures in development snapshots. \\
    $ \min \sum_{dev \in \mathcal{DEV}} \omega_{G13} \cdot \mathbb{I}[\text{test\_status}(dev) = \text{``failed''}] $

    \item \textbf{G14: maximize\_skill\_coverage} \\
    Maximize number of required skills present in the team. \\
    $ \max \sum_{s \in \mathcal{S}} \omega_{G14} \cdot \text{level}(s) $
\end{itemize}

\section{4. Conditions}
\begin{itemize}
    \item \textbf{C0: require\_worker\_email\_validity} \\
    All workers must have valid email addresses. \\
    $ \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \text{email}(w) \neq \emptyset \land \text{valid\_email}(\text{email}(w)) $

    \item \textbf{C1: enforce\_sprint\_duration\_limit} \\
    All sprints must not exceed 30 days. \\
    $ \forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: (\text{end\_date}(sp) - \text{start\_date}(sp)) \leq 30 $

    \item \textbf{C2: ensure\_unique\_project\_names} \\
    Project names must be unique. \\
    $ \forall p_1, p_2 \in \mathcal{P}, p_1 \neq p_2 \Rightarrow \text{name}(p_1) \neq \text{name}(p_2) $

    \item \textbf{C3: require\_product\_owner\_presence} \\
    Each Product Backlog must have an assigned Product Owner. \\
    $ \forall pb \in \mathcal{PB}: \exists po \in \mathcal{PO} \text{ such that } \text{manages\_backlog}(po, pb) $

    \item \textbf{C4: enforce\_task\_status\_validity} \\
    Tasks must have a valid status. \\
    $ \forall tsk \in \mathcal{TSK}: \text{status}(tsk) \in \{\text{todo}, \text{in progress}, \text{done}\} $

    \item \textbf{C5: require\_sprint\_goal\_defined} \\
    Sprint must have a defined goal before starting. \\
    $ \forall sp \in \mathcal{SP}: \text{status}(sp) = \text{active} \Rightarrow \exists sg \in \mathcal{SG} \text{ s.t. } \text{pursues\_goal}(sp, sg) \land \text{objective\_description}(sg) \neq \emptyset $

    \item \textbf{C6: limit\_team\_size} \\
    Team size must not exceed 12 members. \\
    $ \forall t \in \mathcal{T}: \text{team\_size}(t) \leq 12 $

    \item \textbf{C7: enforce\_backlog\_ordered} \\
    Product Backlog must maintain prioritized order. \\
    $ \forall f_1, f_2 \in \mathcal{F} \cap \mathcal{PB}: \text{priority}(f_1) < \text{priority}(f_2) \Rightarrow f_1 \text{ precedes } f_2 $

    \item \textbf{C8: require\_blocker\_resolution\_time} \\
    High-severity blockers must be resolved within 48 hours. \\
    $ \forall bl \in \mathcal{BL}: \text{severity}(bl) = \text{high} \Rightarrow (\text{resolved\_on}(bl) - \text{detected\_on}(bl)) \leq 2 $

    \item \textbf{C9: ensure\_worker\_role\_assignment} \\
    Each worker must have at least one role. \\
    $ \forall w \in \mathcal{W}: \exists r \in \mathcal{R} \text{ s.t. } \text{takes\_on\_role}(w, r) $

    \item \textbf{C10: require\_feature\_priority} \\
    All features must have a defined priority level. \\
    $ \forall f \in \mathcal{F}: \text{priority}(f) \in \{1,2,3\} $

    \item \textbf{C11: enforce\_sprint\_review\_participation} \\
    At least 3 stakeholders must attend each Sprint Review. \\
    $ \forall sr \in \mathcal{SR}: \text{attendees\_count}(sr) \geq 3 $

    \item \textbf{C12: require\_velocity\_calculation} \\
    Velocity must be calculated using at least 3 past sprints. \\
    $ \forall vel \in \mathcal{VEL}: \text{number\_of\_sprints\_used}(vel) \geq 3 $

    \item \textbf{C13: ensure\_documentation\_author\_tracked} \\
    All feature documentation must have an author. \\
    $ \forall fed \in \mathcal{FED}: \text{author}(fed) \neq \emptyset $

    \item \textbf{C14: enforce\_release\_status\_tracking} \\
    All release plans must have a current status. \\
    $ \forall rep \in \mathcal{REP}: \text{status}(rep) \in \{\text{planned}, \text{in progress}, \text{completed}\} $
\end{itemize}

\section{5. DecisionVariables}
\begin{itemize}
    \item $ \mathbf{x}_{tsk,w} \in \{0,1\} $: Task assignment — 1 if task $ tsk $ is assigned to worker $ w $, else 0.
    \item $ a_w \in [0, 160] $: Worker availability in hours per sprint.
    \item $ d_{sp} \in [5, 30] $: Duration of sprint $ sp $ in days.
    \item $ p_{sp} \in [1, 50] $: Planned story points for sprint $ sp $.
    \item $ r_f \in [1, 10] $: Priority rank of feature $ f $.
    \item $ n_t \in [3, 12] $: Number of members in team $ t $.
    \item $ v_{rep} \in [1.0, 10.0] $: Version number of release plan $ rep $.
    \item $ c_{fed} \in [0.0, 1.0] $: Completion fraction of feature documentation $ fed $.
    \item $ s_{bl} \in \{1,2,3,4,5\} $: Severity level of blocker $ bl $.
    \item $ m_{ds} \in [5, 30] $: Duration of daily scrum $ ds $ in minutes.
    \item $ l_{w,s} \in \{1,2,3,4,5\} $: Skill level of worker $ w $ in skill $ s $.
    \item $ g_{sp} \in [0, 100] $: Achievement score (\%) of sprint goal for $ sp $.
    \item $ \delta_{tsk} \in [-20.0, 20.0] $: Deviation between estimated and actual effort for task $ tsk $.
    \item $ \omega_{sh} \in [0.1, 1.0] $: Influence weight of stakeholder $ sh $.
    \item $ \tau_{vel} \in \{-1, 0, 1\} $: Velocity trend (-1: down, 0: stable, 1: up).
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
```

---

### ✅ How to Use This File

1. Save the content as `scrum_optimization.tex`.
2. Compile using `pdflatex` or Overleaf.
3. Output: A professional PDF with structured optimization model.

### 🔍 Notes

- All **Goals** are maximized or minimized as per `GoalType`.
- **Conditions** are hard constraints (must-match, `CriteriaType = 2`) unless otherwise modeled.
- **Weights** $ \omega_{Gx} $ represent the `Weight` column from `Goals.csv`.
- Indicator functions $ \mathbb{I}[\cdot] $ are used for counting logical conditions.
- Sets are derived directly from `Entities.csv` and named using `SetName`.

Let me know if you'd like a version with objective function aggregation, constraint relaxation, or integration with a solver (e.g., Gurobi, CPLEX syntax).
